verses.roman:
athomā tam ṛṣiṁ vīkṣya
giriśaṁ samabhāṣata
paśyemaṁ bhagavan vipraṁ
nibhṛtātmendriyāśayam

synonyms: atha—then; umā—Umā; tam—that; ṛṣim—sage; vīkṣya—seeing; giriśam—to Lord Śiva; samabhāṣata—spoke; paśya—just see; imam—this; bhagavan—my lord; vipram—learned brāhmaṇa; nibhṛta—motionless; ātma-indriya-āśayam—his body, senses and mind.
translation: Goddess Umā, seeing the sage, addressed Lord Giriśa: My lord, just see this learned brāhmaṇa, his body, mind and senses motionless in trance.
